results.title: A Year to Remember 1933
results.brief_description: Collection of newsreel footage, which made up Australia’s history in 1933 - Kingsford-Smith arrives in Brisbane - Royal Navy destroyers - Gift from British Government - Discovery of gold in Australia, Los Angeles - Heavyweight boxer, Primo Carnera, fights kangaroo, Billycart racing at Bellevue Hill, Sydney - Fashions for women - Bondi Beach- Bodyline bowling creates controversy- Great trotting pacer Walla Walla… and much more. Rated: G

results.title: A Year to Remember 1932
results.brief_description: Collection of newsreel footage, which made up Australia’s history in 1932 - The Depression - Opening the Sydney Harbour Bridge - De Groot cuts ribbon - Hiking. Popular pastime in the Depression - Annette Kellerman at home-coming reception - Boy Charlton swimming events - Wizard Smith breaks the world land speed record - US sailors die trying to bring the dirigible ‘Akron’ down - Kingsford-Smith congratulates Scotty - and much more. Rated: G

results.title: A Year to Remember 1931
results.brief_description: This unique collection of film brings together all the drama, the fun, the people, the sport and the lifestyles which made up Australia’s history from 1931 through to 1956. The Depression - Horses bringing in the wheat Jack Lang, NSW Premier - Disappearance of the Southern Cloud - Sir Douglas Mawson welcomed back - Attempt to split the atom - Building of Sydney Harbour Bridge - Earthquake scenes at Hawkes Bay NZ - Dame Nellie Melba’s funeral - Sir Malcolm Campbell in the Bluebird … and much more. Rated: G

results.title: A Year of change in three children (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cognitive Development”.
It is not until 5 years old or so that children come to understand the notions of conservation of area, length and weight. This program, recorded at Nottingham primary school, examines the responses of three children to various Piagetian tests over a period of one year.

results.title: A Year in Provence
results.creator_credit: David Tucker, Ken Riddington and BBC
results.brief_description: Based on Peter Mayles’ best selling novel, Peter and his wife Annie decide to take “Le Plunge” and abandon the rat-race of England to live in an old farmhouse at the foot of the Luberon Mountains in Provence. Coping with the language and the idiosyncratic behaviour and customs of the locals form the basis of their daily life.

results.title: A Year in London
results.brief_description: Two Dutch children come to London on a year’s school exchange visit. After being met by their English hosts, a boy and girl of the same age, the fur children explore the sights of London; National Maritime Museum, Convent Garden market, Drury Lane, Fleet Street, the Strand, the Changing of the Guard at the Horse Guards, and Trafalgar Square.

results.title: A Writer's legacy
results.brief_description: Heather’s father believed in his daughter as a writer even when she did not believe in herself. He left her letters and memorabilia but the real legacy her father left her was the love of writing.
